image.altText: A satellite view of a scrap metal processing site with large stockpiles of metal.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's EPA has ordered a north Tasmanian scrap metal facility to immediately stop using a metal shredder after "elevated levels of lead" were found in the dust it produced.

title.children: EPA warns lead contamination from Tasmanian metal recycler a 'public health issue'

image.altText: GPS tracker on an ankle with person wearing a black shoe.

props.synopsis: The immigration minister rejects suggestions the government lifted ankle monitoring devices from a number of detainees in order to scupper legal challenges to the laws launched in the High Court.

title.children: Detainees scrap High Court challenges after government removes ankle monitoring devices

image.altText: A woman leans on a fence on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Janet Ainscow lives next door to the stable of Tasmania's leading harness racing trainer. She's been speaking out about allegations of team driving at race meets, and the conditions horses are being kept in. It's taken years, but she now feels vindicated.

title.children: Horse trainer Ben Yole's neighbour blew the whistle on him. She finally feels 'vindicated'

image.altText: A shopper looks at clothes on sale

props.synopsis: A major new survey of roughly 1,000 businesses suggests Australian businesses are worried enough about losing customers that shoppers can soon expect to pay significantly less at the check-out.

title.children: Could we be on the cusp of significant cost-of-living relief? One survey hints at where prices are heading

image.altText: A woman sitting at a desk speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Australia's Foreign Minister Penny Wong signals the nation may soon again send aid money to the UNRWA, but the executive director of UNICEF tells 7.30 she understands why nations are uncomfortable given recent allegations.

title.children: UNICEF chief defends UN vetting processes after Australia and others freeze funding for Palestinian refugee agency

image.altText: Timothy King

props.synopsis: We ask people for their experiences of Tasmania's ailing health system and hear of misdiagnoses, long waits for treatment or, worse still, no treatment at all. But we also receive some good reports.

title.children: 'I said X-ray and she said no': The stories you told us about Tasmania's healthcare system

image.altText: Two men with their shirts off pose for a photo at a park

props.synopsis: The heat peaked before it even hit midday for many spots around metropolitan Perth, with scorching mid-40 degree temperatures experienced across the city.

title.children: Western Australia's severe summer heatwave breaks records as parts of Perth hit 45C

image.altText: Three ambulances are parked close to each other, outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: NSW Ambulance is continuing to investigate the breach to determine the full details of the incident, involving the release of an image of Lauren O'Neill's injured leg just after she had arrived at hospital.

title.children: NSW Ambulance apologises for photo leak from hospital emergency of shark victim's leg

image.altText: A close-up of a middle-aged Asian woman with short black hair looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Melbourne poet Grace Yee has won Australia's richest literary award, the Victorian Prize for Literature, for her debut verse novel, Chinese Fish.

title.children: Debut poet takes home $125,000 in prize money for a verse novel that almost wasn't published

image.altText: A nurse wearing a face mask injects a substance into a patient's forehead

props.synopsis: Practitioners say the new rules around cosmetic injectables effectively gags their businesses and limits the information prospective patients can receive about their care.

title.children: TGA's new changes to advertising rules leave cosmetic injectables businesses 'silenced', practitioners say

image.altText: Two men in a suit at a press conference

props.synopsis: Details of the companies and individuals pouring money into the coffers of the nation's political parties last financial year have been published, with some of the country's wealthiest individuals topping the list.

title.children: Clive Palmer and Anthony Pratt lead the way in political donations as corporations play both sides

image.altText: Deepinderjeet 'Deep' Singh sits at a table.

props.synopsis: Friends come together to pay respects to a man who drowned after allegedly being pushed into the river at Hobart's waterfront during a robbery.

title.children: Friends remember 'kind-hearted' uni student who drowned during alleged robbery on Hobart's waterfront

image.altText: Soccer generic

props.synopsis: An independent cybersecurity research company claims to have exposed flaws in Football Australia's digital infrastructure, with millions of participants potentially affected.

title.children: Football Australia data breach exposes player, fan details to public

image.altText: A composite image shows Georgie Purcell in two photos which appear identical except for changes to her clothing.

props.synopsis: A graphics expert says Nine News's explanation for how a digitally altered photo of Victorian Animal Rights Party MP Georgie Purcell was put to air is plausible — and raises important questions over the way the technology is used across society.

title.children: Is Nine's Photoshop explanation for an MP's altered image plausible? Here's what we found

image.altText: Child stuck shopping centre

props.synopsis: Police say the three-year-old climbed into the machine through its prize dispenser.

title.children: 'We can try and win him back': Police rescue 3yo stuck in claw machine

image.altText: A building seen from birds eye view

props.synopsis: As its new school year is set to begin, plans are being drawn up to cater for students and staff who cannot enter grounds which may be beyond salvation.

title.children: Outback high school may need to be demolished because of severe mould outbreak

image.altText: People are seen in a boat in floodwaters in the remote community of Pigeon Hole.

props.synopsis: The NT government says it has the "absolute will" to move Pigeon Hole to higher ground – now leaders want to see a timeline for when it will happen.

title.children: 'Our lives depend on it': Call for NT chief minister to firm up plans to relocate outback community

image.altText: a man with grey hair wearing a hi-vis jacket over a blue collared shirt

props.synopsis: Kevin Gallagher says the company is "working through" the process for recouping legal costs, after a Federal Court ruled in favour of its Barossa project.

title.children: Santos will not pursue legal costs from Tiwi plaintiffs following court battle, CEO says

image.altText: Rainbow lorikeets in single beds in care.

props.synopsis: More than 200 birds with lorikeet paralysis syndrome have been taken in by wildlife carers around Grafton as researchers call on citizen scientists to help find the cause.

title.children: Rainbow lorikeets falling from the sky with mysterious syndrome in northern New South Wales

image.altText: Man looks back at crowd of cameras watching him

props.synopsis: The Move Forward Party was attempting to change some of the world's strictest defamation laws and now faces the risk of dissolution and a ban on its leaders after losing the legal case.

title.children: Thailand's most popular political party faces dissolution after failed bid to change defamation laws

image.altText: Onlookers observe a UN sanctioned mining site in Hpakant area of Kachin state, northern Myanmar

props.synopsis: Justice For Myanmar reported that almost a dozen Australian and Australian-linked mining companies are still operating in the country and investing in its resources sector.

title.children: New sanctions against Myanmar junta don't include Australian-linked mining companies

image.altText: young couple put sold sticker on billboard of their newly purchased home.

props.synopsis: House prices are on track to rise across the country, propelled by renters and migrants wanting to buy their own homes and buyers trying to get in ahead of interest rate cuts expected later this year.

title.children: The gap between house and unit prices has reached a record high, as values keep climbing

image.altText: A young woman and a young man stand with arms oustretched in front of a small

props.synopsis: We wanted to own our own home without getting too far into debt, so we built a modest one-bedroom home on a block of land in regional Tasmania, with plans to extend it in the future.

title.children: How a young couple built the modest one-bedroom home they could afford

image.altText: Close-up of Daniel Keneally, disgraced police officer outside Downing Centre Local Court

props.synopsis: The disgraced police officer son of former senator Kristina Keneally has been handed a 15-month intensive correction order.

title.children: Son of former NSW premier sentenced for fabricating evidence that put innocent man in jail

image.altText: Two women embrace outside a burnt building.

props.synopsis: Many Israelis say that they will never forgive Palestinians for what Hamas did. It's this "never forgiving" that puts the two sides further apart than ever in this decades-old conflict, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Jump on a plane to Israel and you'll see one of the enduring ways life has changed since October 7

image.altText: Large green tractors on the highway surrounded by people.

props.synopsis: European farmers are angry about rising costs, environmental policies and cheap food imports — especially from Ukraine. And they're not shy about letting politicians know about it.

title.children: Tractors are blocking highways outside Paris. Why are farmers protesting across Europe?

image.altText: Kurtley Beale outside court wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: During the call, former Wallabies star Kurtley Beale told the woman he is accused of sexually assaulting, he "misjudged the whole scenario" and apologised multiple times, the court heard.

title.children: 'Convince him he's guilty': Woman accusing Kurtley Beale of sexual assault made notes before phone call, court told

image.altText: Israeli drone in Gaza

props.synopsis: Approvals to export Australian made military equipment to Israel are being "stalled" by the Albanese government as concerns grow over the rising number of civilian casualties in Gaza.

title.children: Australia 'stalls' military export requests from Israel over Gaza war concerns, growing number of civilian casualties

image.altText: group of lifeguards, most with faces blurred

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation tracks former Sunshine Coast teacher and coach Dean Carelse to a family holiday park in south-west England.

title.children: Queensland paedophile and former water polo coach employed as children's lifeguard in UK

image.altText: Smiling middle-aged man grey receding hair, stubble, wears teal blue shirt, light blue stands in paddock with dairy cows behind.

props.synopsis: Momentum is growing in one of Australia's largest cattle-producing states to overturn a ban on virtual fencing technology. However, a peak animal welfare charity says using electric shocks to train animals raises significant ethical and animal welfare concerns.

title.children: Farmer says virtual fencing 'appropriate', but RSPCA says electric shock causes 'acute stress' to animals

image.altText: The front entrance of the urgent care centre at Colac.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Department of Health investigates allegations "fake patients" were organised to appear at Colac Area Health's urgent care centre during a visit by the Health Minister last year.

title.children: Government investigates claim regional hospital staff and family posed as patients during minister's visit

image.altText: A power pole with three wires, one of which has been cut.

props.synopsis: One business owner had his water pipes blow out because he was unable to monitor the pressure of his 140-kilometre-long system.

title.children: Copper thieves trigger three-week Telstra outage, pipeline blowout in NSW wine country

image.altText: Margot Robbie wearing a pale pink sequined strapless mini dress with coreset-like detailing and sheer heels

props.synopsis: Margot Robbie has addressed controversy over Barbie's absence from the best director and best actress categories at the 2024 Oscars.

title.children: Margot Robbie breaks silence on Barbie Oscars snub

image.altText: composite image of Ross Knight of Cosmic Psychos, Debbie Harry of Blondie, and Brian Molko of Placebo

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns defends his decision to relocate the Pandemonium event from the Domain in the CBD to Sydney Olympic Park.

title.children: NSW premier defends switching venue for rock music festival after outcry over Anzac Day clash

image.altText: A young man hugs his girlfriend whose face is blurred as they stand in front of a park

props.synopsis: Prosecutors tell a court Andre Rebelo was in financial strife and murdered his mother to gain access to her money.

title.children: Perth man killed his mother for her life insurance money, prosecutors will allege
